data: Il miliario siciliano del console C. Aurelio Cotta
A. Di Vita, «Il miliario siciliano del console C. Aurelio Cotta», Latomus 22 (1963): 478–88

Both Castelli and Gualtherus note that the stone had suffered significant damage to the letters. Agustín and Gualtherus report a continuous text with no gaps, but Castelli suggests that two whole lines are missing both before and after the third surviving line of text.
No reliable description of the letter forms is preserved.
193 BCE (if identification of L. Scipio Asiagenus accepted)

1Italicei
2L(ucium) Cornelium Sc[ip]i[one]m
3honoris caussa

Deep and well carved, with a U-shaped cut letters of generally regular height. Most letters are c.75mm tall; O is consistently smaller than the other letters (55-60 mm), S taller at 95 mm, and the numeral 50 is 110 mm. A deep round interpunct is viisble at the end of line 3.
Photo J. Prag, 2023.10.28, courtesy Museo Civico di Corleone.
